results.title: Blackadder goes forth. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: The Western Front 1917: Captain Blackadder joins the British Army and has to take orders from two homicidal maniacs - one called the Charge of the Light Brigade ‘a victory for common sense’, and the other called Darling. “Private Plane” sees the German machine guns in front, British firing squads behind - the only way out is to tiddly-up-up! Guest starring Rik Mayall and Ade Edmonson as two dashing arch-rivals. “General Hospital”, guest stars Miranda Richardson as a Florence Nightingale-type ordered to find a spy in a military hospital. Blackadder spots a man with a strong German accent, a beautiful nurse and a chance for three weeks in bed. “Goodbyeee” guest stars Geoffrey Palmer is a megalomaniacal Field Marshall when the big push is finally looming and with the help of two pencils and a pair of underpants, Blackadder goes stir-fry crazy!

results.title: Blackadder goes forth. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: The Western Front 1917: Captain Blackadder, finds himself crammed into a trench, only twenty yards from heavily armed people who want to kill him. Worse still, his brother officer Lieutenant George (Hugh Laurie) is a man whose family brain cell is gathering dust in a pawn shop in Dunstable, and Baldrick (Tony Robinson) is in charge of the cooking! “Captain Cook”: When General Haigh unveils his new strategy to conquer the fearful hun, Blackadder volunteers to be Official War Artist. “Corporal punishment”: As orders for Operation Insanity reach Blackadder, he breaches regulations by eating the messenger. Can the Flanders Pigeon Murderer avoid the firing squad? “Major Star” finds the great cynical one faced with even greater problems as the Russian Revolution produces two more appalling results: an offensive by Germany and a really offensive Charlie Chaplin impersonation by Baldrick. Guest stars Gabrielle Glaister as Driver Bob Parkhurst, the world’s worst female impersonator.

results.title: Blackadder's Christmas carol
results.brief_description: Dickens’ classic tale of kindness, truth and virtue completely mucked up and ruined by having a member of the Blackadder family involved. Also Baldrick, of course the man you can rely on to turn a Christmas dinner into a dog’s dinner, as long as the dog isn’t particularly fussy. Stuffed with deeply horrid people (many of whom are gigantically fat) and groaning with cartloads of seasonal bottom jokes, it manages to squeeze in not only a Victorian Blackadder but also his famous Elizabethan, Regency and Space Age relatives into a huge pie of entertainment that will satisfy all but the most discriminating viewers. Stars, Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson, Robbie Coltrane, Miranda Richardson, Hugh Laurie and Stephen Fry. Written by Richard Curtis and Ben Elton.

results.title: Black widow
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Harold Schneider and Bob Rafelson
results.brief_description: A fascinating reworking of the film noir genre, with Teresa Russell performing the femme fatale Reni, who seduces then murders a string of unsuspecting men, and Debra Winger taking on the role of the unsatisfied FBI agent Alex. Alex’s investigation is complicated by her increasing obsession with Reni and the sexual tension between the two, which threatens to bring about the downfall of both. A gripping and intricate film that raises interesting questions about love, desire and death.

results.title: Black Tuesday
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and W. Batty
results.brief_description: A report on the disastrous bushfires on the outskirts of Hobart on the 7th of February, 1967. Shows scenes during the fires, the damage caused, and interviews with people involved. The temporary housing and rehabilitation of homeless fire victims is described.

results.title: Black tide
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and David E. Barrow
results.brief_description: As a coastal dwelling nation, Australia has a lot to lose from any large oil spills. So far the nation has not suffered major sea pollution problems comparable with some maritime nations. As a form of protection of Australian waters against oil pollution, a co-ordinated National Plan has been devised by government agencies to be actioned immediately a threat of pollution arises. This film, sponsored by the Commonwealth Department of Transport describes the extent of that plan to protect Australian coastal ecosystems and economics. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Black sun
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, Amanda Jane and Hugh Burton
results.brief_description: The story begins and ends with a funeral. A group of female friends unite for a night of drugs, music and memories under the full moon. One of the girls has been away to the city, and discovers that things don’t stay the same, that friendships change, and can be challenged and proven very quickly. Cast includes Raelee Hill and Brigid Kelly.

results.title: Black scour worm
results.creator_credit: Australian Wool Corporation and Tom Price
results.brief_description: This film, deals with the prevention and control of the black scour worm, a parasitic worm which occurs in sheep, cattle, goats and rabbits.The infection is usually picked up in the autumn when feed is short, and symptoms occur in winter: a wet autumn and a dry winter is particularly dangerous. The film stresses that whilst it is almost impossible to eradicate the infection, it is possible to control it to such an extent that economic loss is prevented. The importance of drenching early, when the sheep are fat, is stressed; breeding ewes should be drenched before lambing, especially before autumn lambing, so that the lambs do not become heavily infected; lambs should be drenched at weaning; drenching should be done fairly regularly every four to five weeks from autumn until spring, the wetter the season the more frequent should the treatment be. The film ends by stressing that pastoralists should try to check the growth of the black scour worms long before the sheep show any symptoms of the disease. Narrated by Bob Pollard.

results.title: Black Samson
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Omni Pictures, Daniel B. Cady and Charles Bail
results.brief_description: One of the more conscientious and political ‘right on’ of the Blaxploitation genre, Charles Bail’s (‘Cleopatra Jones and the Casino of gold’) ‘Black Samson’ stars Rockne Tarkington as Samson, a community minded nightclub owner whose softly spoken voice and peaceful demure doesn’t deter him from sticking it to the ‘man’ when drugs invade his inner city neighbourhood. His saintly like persona is further enhanced by the staff he carries with him everywhere, which also happens to be a deadly weapon when needed. Samson’s patience is tested when the mafia begin to recruit some of the black gangs in his hood to help them distribute drugs in the area. Things get personal however when the mob rough-up his girlfriend in order to dissuade him from interfering with their racket. Naturally all hell breaks loose as Samson bands with his neighbourhood to combat the drug menace and settle his personal score. Cast also includes William Smith, Connie Strickland, Michael Payne and Carol Speed.
